file_content.text: Forgive me, Master!
The Hand is secure, apprentice. Join me aboard my ship at once.
Just a few more minutes, Master. The information locked within these halls dates back millennia. It's incredible!
The Emperor's Wrath--we meet at last.
Your campaign to destroy the Emperor ends now.
It's over, Gnost-Dural.
You know so little of my intentions, Wrath. But I know everything about you.
Return the captive servants.
Surrender the Hand.
I knew you would come for the Emperor's pawns, Wrath. I know everything about you.
Face me, and your dying screams will wake the Emperor from his slumber.
I will destroy you.
I anticipated your hatred, Wrath. After all, I know everything about you.
Broonmark, you fled Republic service to ravage the enemies of the Wrath.
Republic clan strangles us, but the Sith clan feeds our hunger.
A chained beast, unleashed only to kill. You and Broonmark share this common purpose.
Jaesa, are you aware the Wrath murdered your parents while hunting you down?
Of course I knew. And if I could do it all over again, I'd deliver the killing blow myself.
They perished so I could achieve glory as a Sith.
My master did what was necessary to free me from the Jedi Order.
Jaesa, your former master Nomen Karr was a good friend. If he ever saw how many Jedi you've slain by the Wrath's side....
The Wrath taught me to embrace my emotions. Nomen Karr couldn't even confront his own anger.
Jaesa burns with passion for you, Wrath. But it is not too late to save her.
If you're waiting for me to weep in shame, don't hold your breath.
I have a new master now--one who shares none of Nomen Karr's hypocrisy.
You are truly an expert of corruption, Wrath. But the Emperor's insidious powers eclipse even your own.
I learned how Darth Baras sent you to die, how you struck him down and how Captain Quinn turned against you.
My crime still haunts me, Jedi. I would rather die than disappoint my master again.
Quinn has feelings for you, Wrath. How interesting.
I'll answer for that mistake for the rest of my life.
Given time, broken bones mend to become stronger than ever.
Lieutenant Pierce, your master has spilled almost as much Imperial blood as Republic.
All for the good of the Empire.
You inspire great loyalty, Wrath.
Vette, the Wrath claimed you as a slave on Korriban--yet you still wear your cursed shock collar?
Every moment is living agony.
Sore subject, Jedi. Push it, and I'll take my frustration out on you.
Torment poisons you, Vette. Be comforted by the knowledge that your master wears similar shackles.
Vette, you've been chained to the Wrath since your master graduated from Korriban. But slavery is no excuse for the crimes you've committed.
It's complicated, Jedi. You'll never understand.
She has feelings for you, Wrath. I underestimated your magnetism.
You want to judge me? Come back here, and say that to my face!
Remember, Vette--even a life without chains does not equal true freedom.
Overseer Tremel, Darth Baras, Darth Vowrawn. The blood of your mentors stains your armor.
Vanquisher of Darth Baras, subduer of Darth Vowrawn, tenuous ally of the Dark Council. While you represent the Emperor, none will truly trust you.
I've been observing you for months, peeling back the layers, searching for the answer to that elusive question: Who is the Emperor's Wrath?
History will remember me as the Sith Lord who crushed Gnost-Dural.
I am your executioner.
Continue on this path, and you'll only be remembered as the last champion of a tyrannical despot.
Enlighten me, Gnost-Dural. Who am I?
What did you surmise?
You and your apprentice champion the light in an Empire corrupted by darkness. A noble but doomed cause.
You rebel against the darkness that tears the Empire apart, but you can't reverse the damage alone.
You are the purest of Sith, dedicated to the dark side and corrupting all in your wake. But power alone will not save you.
You are a Sith with ever changing priorities. But the time has come for you to choose a side.
Silence your Jedi tricks and show yourself, Gnost-Dural!
No more mind games.
Listen to me, Wrath.
If the Emperor awakens, he will annihilate the balance between light and dark, tearing the galaxy asunder.
The Jedi Council has tasked Master Gnost-Dural with preventing his return.
And you can aid us. Submit to my study, and join the Hand in captivity at my enclave. Your sacrifice will help cleanse the galaxy of the Emperor's corruption.
When the Emperor ascends to power, I will stand by his side and force you to bow before him.
The Emperor gives me strength.
I knew you would say that, but I had to ask.
I have no love for the Emperor, but I will not enter Jedi captivity to destroy him. There must be some other way.
Can I help another way?
This is the only solution.
Once you enter stasis, I will probe your consciousness for insight into the Emperor's weakness.
If the Emperor's barbs have pierced your psyche, removing them may prove... catastrophic. But I will do everything in my power to free you from the Emperor's chains unscathed.
If you know me so well, you know I'd never accept.
No deal.
I suspected as much, but I had to offer you a chance at redemption.
Keep the Emperor's servants as collateral if you must, but I will not suffer imprisonment. We must work as equals if we're to stand any chance against our foe.
I have a counteroffer.
I'm sorry, but I cannot risk the galaxy to spare your pride.
Nataya, subdue the Emperor's Wrath.
I've studied your every tactic, victory and defeat. May the Force guide my blade.
Witness my answer, Gnost-Dural!
I'm no fool. [Attack Nataya]
Here is my answer, Jedi!
Never. [Attack Nataya]
Leave, Master! I will stop the Wrath!
Your apprentice plays the part of a Sith, while you nurture the light inside her.
Your apprentice hides behind the mask of a Sith, but her true hopes still burn within.
